moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: Bd3 I feel this is a departure from standard Siclian play - would have expected Be3 - Yugoslav attack
moves.7. O-O O-O 8. Nd5: Nd5 somewhat of a surprise - not part of the white response to the dragon that I expected
moves.8... Nxd5: With the white bishop blocking the queen, should win a knight
moves.9. exd5 Bxd4 10. Be3 Bf6: missed an opportunity, could had done Bxb2
moves.15. Rb1: up 4, content with trading Bishop for a Bishop - gets the qN developed
moves.15... Bc3 16. Re3 Qc8: don't like the queen defending both a bishop and a pawn, want to do b6 asap
moves.17. Rb3 Bf6 18. Reh3 Nc5: I feel that Nc4 is a good outpost - N can't be chased by a pawn, also forces a move by white
moves.19. Rb4 b6: somewhat of a timid move - probably better moves available - was locked into freeing up the Q but b6 wasn't required
moves.20. Rf3 Qd7: Wanted to get Q off the back rank
moves.21. Rbf4: Rf4 causes me great consternation.  While Rxf6 is unprofitable for White, it does create pressure I could do without.   I feel that the next move is pivotal toward the outcome of the game, lots of bloody scenarios but I am ahead.  In the upcoming exchanges, I feel I will lose a pawn but will still be ahead
moves.21... g5: Will probably lose a pawn but seems to be lessor of evils
moves.22. Rf4f5 Ne4: get some more defense for the g pawn
moves.23. Qd4: somewhat of a surprise - is this a blunder? - expected Qe1 - pressures the Knight but Queen is safe
moves.24. Rf5xf7: losing a pawn for a queen - will take that exchange.  While doubled rooks spook me, especially with the bishop on h6, I see this as a threat I can survive.  Rf8 would be a disaster for me.
moves.24... Qb5: Qb1# first move I am not in check
moves.25. Rg7+: Rg7+?  Is this another blunder. Did not see Bxg7 at first.  Was thinking Kh8 but Bxg7 looks better. This has been a very good dragon bishop - captured a pawn, Queen, and about to capture a Rook while only giving up a pawn
moves.25... Bxg7:
If he recaptures Bxg7,  Qb1#checkmate, if h3, not sure if Bxh6 or Be5 to cut off king escape
White resigns
